title: (0Day) Parallels Desktop virtio-net Memory Corruption Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows local attackers to escalate privileges on affected installations of Parallels Desktop. An attacker must first obtain the ability to execute high-privileged code on the target guest system in order to exploit this vulnerability.
The specific flaw exists within the virtio-net virtual device. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, which can result in a memory corruption condition. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to escalate privileges and execute arbitrary code in the context of the hypervisor.
addtionnal_details:
This vulnerability is being disclosed publicly without a patch in accordance with the ZDI 120 day deadline.

03/24/21 – ZDI reported the vulnerability to the vendor03/26/21 – The vendor acknowledged the report08/20/21 – ZDI requested an update08/27/21 – ZDI requested an update08/27/21 – The vendor indicated a fix would be included in the next release08/27/21 – ZDI requested an ETA for the next release and notified the vendor of the intention to publish the report as a 0-day advisory09/07/21 – ZDI notified the vendor of the intention to publish the case as a 0-day advisory on 09/14/21

-- Mitigation:Given the nature of the vulnerability the only salient mitigation strategy is to restrict interaction with the application.
